name: vaultwarden
description: Vaultwarden is a self-hosted Bitwarden-compatible server written in Rust. It provides the backend for web, mobile, and browser clients to store and sync encrypted passwords and secrets.
features: Password management: Store and sync passwords, passkeys, and credentials across all devices securely.
Bitwarden compatible: Use official Bitwarden clients on web, desktop, mobile, and browser extensions.
End-to-end encryption: Encrypt all data with your master password before it leaves your device.
Secure sharing: Share passwords and notes with other users or organizations with granular permissions.
Two-factor authentication: Protect your vault with 2FA using TOTP, WebAuthn, or other methods.
Password generator: Generate strong, random passwords with customizable length and character sets.
Secure notes: Store sensitive text information like recovery codes or private keys securely.
File attachments: Attach files to vault items for storing documents and certificates.
Organizations: Create organizations to share passwords and items with teams or family members.
Lightweight: Run efficiently with minimal resources compared to official Bitwarden server.
API access: Integrate with other tools using the Bitwarden-compatible REST API.
Self-hosted control: Keep all password data on your own infrastructure with complete control.
